snippet: Last season, the Yankees brought in affordable, veteran starting pitchers with low expectations and were richly rewarded. Is it worth trying this low-risk strategy again?
abstract: Last season, the Yankees brought in affordable, veteran starting pitchers with low expectations and were richly rewarded. Is it worth trying this low-risk strategy again?
lead_paragraph: The Yankees seem just fine with entering 2012 with a five-man rotation of C.C. Sabathia, Phil Hughes, Ivan Nova, A. J. Burnett and Freddy Garcia. They were not willing to spend lavishly on a good, but not great, starting pitcher like C. J. Wilson and do not appear to be on the verge of signing other decent hurlers like Edwin Jackson, as Tyler Kepner wrote last week.

headline.main: Low-Risk Options Remain for the Yankees
